## Conversation that answers the provided questions:
**User:**
I've been looking into the Verus DeFi protocol and I'm curious about how it addresses Miner Extracted Value (MEV) and front-running issues in cryptocurrency conversions. Additionally, I'd like to know more about the benefits of launching a new blockchain with a decentralized or centralized "bridge" converter liquidity pool.

**AI Assistant:**
The Verus DeFi protocol tackles the issues of Miner Extracted Value (MEV) and front-running in cryptocurrency conversions by ensuring that all conversions using a particular liquidity pool and mined into one block are solved and priced simultaneously. This approach provides a fair and efficient way to perform conversions, eliminating the problems associated with MEV and front-running.

One of the key benefits of the Verus DeFi protocol is its ability to integrate DeFi liquidity pools directly into the consensus and cross-chain bridge protocols. This integration enables fee-based DeFi incentives for miners and stakers, ensuring smooth consensus operation and fee conversion capabilities.

When launching a new blockchain, Verus offers the option to simultaneously launch a fully decentralized or centralized "bridge" converter liquidity pool. This bridge converter liquidity pool is bound to the launch of the new blockchain and runs on the new blockchain, allowing for seamless connectivity and eliminating rent going back to the Verus blockchain.

The launch of a new blockchain with a bridge converter liquidity pool offers several benefits, including:

* The ability to set required minimum levels of worldwide participation in preferred currencies on the chain, with automatic refunds if minimums are not met.
* Maximum participation limits in one or more currencies.
* Pre-launch discounts.
* Price-neutral pre-allocations to select IDs that increase the fractional reserve ratio to issue currencies.
* Price-neutral carve-outs.

Overall, the Verus DeFi protocol and its integrated bridge converter liquidity pool provide a robust and efficient way to launch new blockchains and perform cryptocurrency conversions, while addressing the issues of MEV and front-running.

## Simultaneous blockchain and blockchain liquidity pool launches
 - Launch of a world class, worldwide, merge-mineable blockchain along with a fully decentralized or centralized “bridge” converter liquidity pool as part of defining a new blockchain. Bridge converter currencies have the same flexibility as other fractional 100% asset backed or partially asset backed currencies, but is bound to the launch of the new blockchain, runs on the new blockchain, and all fees generated via cross chain fee conversions or general use of the liquidity pool are earned on the new blockchain with no rent going back to the Verus blockchain, only seamless connectivity.
## Blockchain-based, crowdfunding currency launches with minimum participation or automatic refunds, including for dual launches (blockchain and bridge)
- Set required minimum levels of worldwide participation in your preferred currencies on chain. If by the start time of your blockchain, minimums are not met, all participants will automatically get a refund of all of their pre-conversions, less the network fees. The launch options also provide for maximum participation in one or more currencies, pre-launch discounts, price neutral pre-allocations to select IDs that increase the fractional reserve ratio to issue currencies, similarly price neutral carve-outs
